description: A large scale open flute of 8' pitch, often made of wood and sometimes having double mouths (see Doppelflöte). Audsley claims it is of medium scale. Irwin describes its tone as �midway between dull and bright�. Skinner claims Gross Flute to be �an obsolete 8' wood Diapason; an exaggerated Claribel Flute�.
examplesDescription: Osiris contains three dozen examples, all at 8' except for two at 16' and one at 4'. The earliest examples are given below.

examples.name: Grosse Flute 8', Grand Orgue; Cathedral, Murcia, Spain; Merklin 1857.
Grosse Flûte 8', Pèdale; St. Sernin, Toulouse, France; Cavaillé-Coll 1889.
Grosse Flöte 16', Pedal; Priory, Bridlington, England; Anneessens 1889.
